paper_abstract: When nonlinear behaviors of soil are important in a soil structure interaction system, radiation of energy into the infinity of the soil as well as the nonlinearity must be considered rigorously. In this study, perfectly matched discrete layers (PMDLs) are employed to represent the radiation of energy rigorously. A time-domain formulation for a soil structure interaction is given using the layers. To represent a layered half-space effectively and accurately, a method to determine PMDL parameters for the half-space is proposed. It is demonstrated that the proposed PMDL system can be applied successfully to problems of nonlinear soil structure interaction. (C) 2014 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Nonlinear analysis of soil-structure interaction using perfectly matched discrete layers
